body_html:
One way to reproduce is to open some other Tensorflow sessions on the same host. I.e.:

tf_sess.py:

import tensorflow as tf
import time
s = tf.Session()
time.sleep(30)

and then execute

python tf_sess.py &
python tf_sess.py &
python example.py

yields

2017-09-20 08:01:36.029417: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:965] Found device 0 with properties:
name: GeForce GTX 980 major: 5 minor: 2 memoryClockRate(GHz): 1.2785
pciBusID: 0000:04:00.0
totalMemory: 3.94GiB freeMemory: 149.75MiB
2017-09-20 08:01:36.029446: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:1055] Creating TensorFlow device (/device:GPU:0) -> (device: 0, name: GeForce GTX 980, pci bus id: 0000:04:00.0, compute capability: 5.2)
test_op_32 [ -6.38132574e+37   2.93414410e-38   2.77472790e-38   4.32417032e+17] test_op_64 [ 2.  0.  2.  4.]
2017-09-20 08:01:36.044647: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:1055] Creating TensorFlow device (/device:GPU:0) -> (device: 0, name: GeForce GTX 980, pci bus id: 0000:04:00.0, compute capability: 5.2)
test_op_32 [ 2.  0.  2.  4.] test_op_64 [ 2.  0.  2.  4.]
2017-09-20 08:01:36.050076: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:1055] Creating TensorFlow device (/device:GPU:0) -> (device: 0, name: GeForce GTX 980, pci bus id: 0000:04:00.0, compute capability: 5.2)
test_op_32 [  1.42191624e-13   2.90286264e-39              nan   4.26825146e-22] test_op_64 [ 2.  0.  2.  4.]

The number of open sessions necessary to reproduce may vary depending on the amount of memory they consume. For me two worked, but one was not sufficient.

tf_sess.py:
import tensorflow as tf

body:
One way to reproduce is to open some other Tensorflow sessions on the same host. I.e.:

tf_sess.py:
```
import tensorflow as tf
import time
s = tf.Session()
time.sleep(30)
```

and then execute
```
python tf_sess.py &
python tf_sess.py &
python example.py
```

yields
```
2017-09-20 08:01:36.029417: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:965] Found device 0 with properties:
name: GeForce GTX 980 major: 5 minor: 2 memoryClockRate(GHz): 1.2785
pciBusID: 0000:04:00.0
totalMemory: 3.94GiB freeMemory: 149.75MiB
2017-09-20 08:01:36.029446: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:1055] Creating TensorFlow device (/device:GPU:0) -> (device: 0, name: GeForce GTX 980, pci bus id: 0000:04:00.0, compute capability: 5.2)
test_op_32 [ -6.38132574e+37   2.93414410e-38   2.77472790e-38   4.32417032e+17] test_op_64 [ 2.  0.  2.  4.]
2017-09-20 08:01:36.044647: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:1055] Creating TensorFlow device (/device:GPU:0) -> (device: 0, name: GeForce GTX 980, pci bus id: 0000:04:00.0, compute capability: 5.2)
test_op_32 [ 2.  0.  2.  4.] test_op_64 [ 2.  0.  2.  4.]
2017-09-20 08:01:36.050076: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:1055] Creating TensorFlow device (/device:GPU:0) -> (device: 0, name: GeForce GTX 980, pci bus id: 0000:04:00.0, compute capability: 5.2)
test_op_32 [  1.42191624e-13   2.90286264e-39              nan   4.26825146e-22] test_op_64 [ 2.  0.  2.  4.]
```

The number of open sessions necessary to reproduce may vary depending on the amount of memory they consume. For me two worked, but one was not sufficient.
